Just play paladins 

Overwatch is one of the best games i've played, but gets overshadowed by the lack of development. Since overwatch 1 stopped getting updates in 2019, so they could work on the overwatch 2 and pve. Jeff said they would redifine what a sequel is,  it had potetial to be so great, but lazy developers doing nothing for 3 years has left the game without soul. 

Bring back jeff kaplan.

WAKE UP BILZZARD AND FIX YOUR GAME INSTEAD OF ADDING IT ON STEAM AND EXPECT MORE PLAYERS FROM YOUR SHIT ASS GAME, like seriously all you care rn is adding unnecessary microtransactions and shit pve which is compeltely BLAND and even when starting a game the frames are lagging (in steam) you NEED to add more REAL content to this game, I literally can't believe that this game won GOTY 2016 over uncharted 4 and ds3 and that i played this game for the past 6 years being addicted to it (im still on that situation please help).

I don't know what Blizzard was expecting releasing this on steam, and it looks like they're desperate to get more players after they massively ruined the game with the most idiotic ideas. At launch, Overwatch 1 looked like a really solid hero-shooter, expensive at first, but it had quality, real Blizzard quality. Graphics, characters, lore and most of all, a game for everyone from casuals to people trying hard to get the highest rank possible. The GOTY winner of 2016 who had a bright future ahead of him, but Blizzard began to go downhill. The general negligence of content and increasing balance problems took its toll, until finally Blizzard announced a sequel that was supposed to be a de facto explanation why 1 is treated with neglect. Great, a mountain of promises, pvp stays for free, but pve or alleged main meat 2 with story and character development was supposed to be the theme and encouragement to pay Blizzard once again. Long silence, 1 still in the abyss and god knows what Blizzard is up to, but they finally had to release this sequel, they just didn't even make it in full form. The pve mode wasn't supposed to be added until after release, so we just had pvp and jumped from one game to another.
They couldn't get it worse, the monetization system they added is absolutely the worst â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ I've ever seen. They took the crates that were free and motivated to play, and a store jumped into place. The biggest insult is the fact that those cosmetics you didn't manage to get in part 1 were locked behind a sick paywall. You just got robbed of the content you actually paid for. Apart from the fact that it was impossible to enter the game, the famous 40k people in the queue, but it's already a standard at Blizzard that they can never set servers for the premiere of anything. 2 left us basically the same as 1 only worse. Skins blocked in such a way that you either grind for one legendary skin SEVERAL MONTHS or pay 10 to 20 euros in advance, per skin, for one character.
The graphics have not changed much, if at all, there are simply not enough new maps. Balance got even worse, reducing to 5v5 in favor of esports which they now beat like they beat HOTS. This is not a game made for pure e-sport, but they tried to push it so hard and eventually the Overwatch League is shut down since Blizzard itself pays for leaving the league. There is Overwatch gameplay in it that you want to come back to, but this is one big downgrade compared to 1. The game does not encourage you to play at all, the battlepass that Blizzard promotes so eagerly is the worst made battlepass of any game I have come across. The price is ridiculously high and doesn't reimburse you enough credits to buy the next one. They expect you to pay 10 euros for each season, and from these earned credits you will spend it on some minor cosmetics, forget about legendary ones, grind or pay. New characters, of course, blocked in the battlepass and kindly wait until they let us unlock with some shit challenges. While for old players 1 is not so bad, new players who are supposedly targeted on steam have a tragic situation. Most of the characters are blocked, in a game where changing heroes is key, rookies have to grind it to even have the opportunity to play characters from 1. It's not exclusive to Overtwach because it can be seen in other games, WoW and Diablo 4 beat like in the mouth of a man with shops as soon as the game starts. Such a wow sells mounts for 25 euros (!), Diablo 4 tries hard to force you to buy a battlepass, the game costs over PLN 330, and microtransactions are like in mobiles. It's hard to look at, but the real ordeal was yet to come. The pve mode, the main engine of the sequel has been CANCELED. Thrown in the trash and a hopeless explanation that they can't. A multi-million dollar corporation has a problem with adding a mode to the 2016 game. One big lie, 2 turned out to be nothing more than a scam. It's disgusting that they have now released the story missions from the canceled mode for 15 euros.
3 missions on which you will spend an hour maybe max and they have the audacity to call such money for it. Followed by another â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ bundles with skins and credits for 40 euros. It's the same as you had in 1, but for FREE. Now Overwatch is just a money making machine. It is unknown who this game is for because it does not respect absolutely anyone. Money laundering masquerading as a game that is a shadow of itself and murdered by pure greed. Overwatch, like most other games, is now a graveyard of memories that have been brutally buried with what Blizzard is now guided by: excel bars.

This is the Team Fortress 2 your mum said you already have at home.

World War II (WW2), lasting from 1939 to 1945, was a global conflict involving the majority of the world's nations. It originated from the aftermath of World War I and was primarily driven by territorial disputes, ideological differences, and aggressive expansionist policies of several powers.

The war can be divided into two main theaters: the European Theater and the Pacific Theater. In Europe, the conflict began with Germany's invasion of Poland in 1939, leading to the swift conquest of several nations by the Axis powers, including Germany, Italy, and later Japan. The Allies, primarily led by the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union, and the United States, gradually turned the tide with pivotal battles like Stalingrad, D-Day, and the Battle of Normandy. The war in Europe concluded in May 1945 with Germany's unconditional surrender.

In the Pacific Theater, Japan aimed to establish its dominance in East Asia and the Pacific by expanding its empire. The United States entered the war after the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941. A series of naval and island-hopping campaigns, such as the Battle of Midway and the Pacific Island campaigns, gradually pushed back Japanese forces. The conflict in the Pacific ended in August 1945 after the US dropped atomic bombs on the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, prompting Japan's surrender.

WW2 resulted in immense loss of life and extensive destruction, with an estimated 70-85 million fatalities. The war had profound political, social, and economic consequences. The Holocaust, in which six million Jews were systematically murdered by Nazi Germany, stands as one of the most horrific events in history. The war's conclusion led to the emergence of the United States and the Soviet Union as superpowers, initiating the Cold War that shaped global politics for decades.

In the aftermath of WW2, efforts were made to establish international institutions like the United Nations to promote cooperation and prevent future conflicts. The war's legacy continues to influence geopolitics, international relations, and societies worldwide.
